data.title: Move common widgets from Game to Mods.Common.
data.body: These no longer need to live in the engine code.

data.title: Brought back the HTML documentation for NSIS
data.body: During https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7311 we lost the ability to conveniently install http://packages.ubuntu.com/markdown. However it was annoying anyway as there are several Markdown implementations and they are all just scripts so the `/usr/bin` link names are conflicting and different on any system. This downloads the original script locally and runs it. It fixes `*.md` file not found problems when running NSIS on Linux.

data.title: Allow mods to define custom manifest data.
data.body:
This adds a mechanism for mods to define metadata objects that are populated with data from the manifest.

As a demonstration/test case I have converted the installer data to a module and moved it from the engine into the common mod library.  More of the existing modules should be converted in the future, but for now my main motivation is to use this in a future PR.

Suggested changelog (under Engine): Added support for custom mod data definitions in mod.yaml.

data.title: More benefits for keeping the radar online
data.body:
Possible handicaps for off-lining the radar:
1. Not reveal the fog of war around it if offline.
2. Not detect cloaked units if offline.
3. Still use -20 power when offline.
4. Same health as fake radar when offline.
5. Radar tech tree is disabled if radar is offline.

Possible benefits for on-lining the radar:
1. Make the radar screen more attractive (details not coming).
2. Make units that need radar to be built shot 1 cell longer if radar is online.
3. Make units that need radar to be built more accurate if the radar is online.
4. Make units that need radar to be built see 1 cell longer if radar is online.

Other:
I think there should be an arrow on the screen showing where a beacon is placed before a radar has been possible to build or on lower tech levels.

![openra game_2015_03_10_09_56_12_884](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/6571726/cc6606fe-c70b-11e4-81f7-4eea39f66b2b.png)

data.title: Different deploy commands
data.body:
I was thinking about adding a deploy command that only deploy one unit at a time.

"f" = only one unit exits at a time.
"shift + f" = all units exits

Also see: #7583

data.body: Fixes #7598, a regression from #7156.

data.title: Radar map doesn't show move and attack cursors anymore
data.body: Probably a regression from #7156.

data.title: Added upgrades and fixed prerequisites to use them
data.body:
- Added upgrades production queue and sidebar tab
- Added upgrades for the Con Yard, Barracks, Light, Heavy and High Tech Factory (last one is Atreides only)
- Updated the prerequisites of all structures, infantry and vehicles to use the upgrades
- Fixed the Ix Research building to use vanilla Dune 2000 prerequisites
- Renamed High Tech Facility to High Tech Factory like vanilla Dune 2000
- Given the Air Strike power to the High Tech Factory Upgrade like vanilla

Edit: Closes #3211.

data.title: InfiltrateForExplorationReset.
data.body:
Necessary for RA2.
Infiltration of a radar resets the target's shroud to their current fog (anything not visible by units at that moment).

This is _not_ [InfiltrateForExploration](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits#infiltrateforexploration).

data.title: Refund tooltip
data.body:
This adds an interface that allows a trait to provide custom tooltip information.
I also used it to provide Refund information.

data.title: (Sensitive subject) Fake structures are easily revealed
data.body:
Here is the nuke example:
![8dd04bb4-c3f2-11e4-9b0f-3f9d453de960](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/7567021/b3d35842-f7fa-11e4-86ca-af492ce292c0.png)
![98616086-c3f2-11e4-9a1b-86d6fd933b2a](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/7567026/ba8c04d6-f7fa-11e4-9a19-be54982df7ac.png)

So all you do is wait until he lunches then lunch on his nuke, he does not know where your real one is but you know where his real one is.

data.title: Provide a set of preset player colors to choose from.
data.body:
I like the ability to make your player color a custom color but I also think it would be nice if we had preset colors to choose from or an ability to favorite certain colors. So for people who may like to use blue with Allies and red with Soviets or something similar with GDI/Nod, they wouldn't need to memorize the color selectors settings. Probably just polish, but I figure it would be a good feature.

data.title: Desync on bleed, probably pathfinder related
data.body:
comparing syncreports yielded different values for the PathHash:

``` diff
--- penev_syncreport.log    2015-03-04 20:05:02.896375315 +0100
+++ unit158_syncreport.log  2015-03-04 20:04:05.176374982 +0100
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-Player: Penev (Windows Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7600.0 .NET CLR 4.0.30319.17929)
+Player: Canavusbis (Windows Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1 .NET CLR 4.0.30319.34209)
 Game ID:  (Mod: Red Alert at Version git-43c3621)
 Sync for net frame 276 -------------
 SharedRandom: 2134565514 (#622)
@@ -1614,8 +1614,8 @@
         IsTraitDisabled: True
     247 e1 Antares Health (50)
         hp: 50
-    247 e1 Antares Mobile (28912)
-        PathHash: 1084
+    247 e1 Antares Mobile (28917)
+        PathHash: 1081
         Facing: 192
         CenterPosition: 53510,42249,0
         FromCell: 52,41
```

data.title: Make Exitâ€™s descs more informative.
Support (icon) sequence name variant for veterancy.
data.body:
RA2 needs this for most trainable actors. [RA2 icon list](http://xhp.xwis.net/ra2_icons/).
`e2icon` -> `e2uico`.

data.title: Target lines on return to recharge
data.body:
This is what happens with actors that need to go back to base to rearm when they haven't killed their target:
![7ee5e8e0-c27e-11e4-9fd3-21b19654755e](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/7874997/b742e482-05b7-11e5-81b8-f34f5f591e1c.png)
![8444f416-c27e-11e4-971a-86eed88327df](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/7875000/bc01148a-05b7-11e5-8519-77dd8f6dad76.png)

The target lines here are both weird and misleading. The best solution would be to have a green target line from the heli to the helipad, and a red target line from the helipad to the target.
While this can be done now (I think), it is more or less the same as the queued activity indicators (waypoints), which OpenRA is currently missing.

data.title: "Game settings" Tab in Settings menu
data.body:
Here you can change in game behavior like:
- Default stances on different units/turrets (the default stance a units/turrets have when entering the world).
- If you want to empty the apc/transport helicopter etc. or just exit one unit when you press "unit command -Deploy" (default f) or press deploy directly on the unit. See #7604

data.title: Add Moq.dll to the gitignore.
Clarify the error relating to too many frames defined in a sequence.
data.body:
~~`Sequence gaweap.make uses frames [0..24] of SHP 'gtweapmk', but only 0..49 actually exist` -> `Sequence gaweap.make uses frames [0..50] of SHP 'gtweapmk', but only [0..49] actually exist`~~

Checks shadow frames separately and throws with a related error, if necessary.

data.title: Use correct frame indices in the asset browser.
data.body:
Puts total frame count in parentheses.
This removes mental math (even as simple as +/-1) while working with sequences.

I can change the VQA frame count info if that is desired, also.

data.title: Avoid MSVC120 runtime dependency for Lua Windows DLLs
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7363.

Essentially the same thing we did in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7212, but this time for `lua51.dll` as well.
